The meetings weren't that interesting or important and no decisions were made.
These "documents" are not "internal."

Ethereum isn't dying anytime soon.

1011749605783097346.text:
Ethereum 2.0 rips out every piece of today’s $ETH and replaces it with: 

+New VM (WASM)
+New Consensus (PoS)
+New Blockchain Design (Sharding) 

The degree of difficulty is high, sure, but if it happens, these are major upgrades related to:

+Accessibility
+Security
+Performance

1111780404007186432.text:
In today's edition of What's New in Eth2, we indulge in a little stock taking after the first nine months of the #Ethereum 2 adventure. What a whirlwind!

https://notes.ethereum.org/c/Sk8Zs--CQ/https%3A%2F%2Fbenjaminion.xyz%2Fnewineth2%2F20190329.html …

1110666567799459840.text:
My wife's away, so I can pretty much get up to anything I like 

How am I using this freedom? I'm staying up past my bedtime reading about elliptic curve pairings  YOLO!

1109880495041597440.text: Mum's latest book is out! There's so much in it about Constantinople and the Byzantines that it could be the story of an Ethereum core devs meeting. But I didn't find ProgPow in the index pic.twitter.com/RHI91kL7UP

1109792835719626753.text:
I had my recurring dream again: that I keep finding delightful new rooms in my house that I never knew existed.

I've come to suspect that it's really about working in blockchain R&D

1109219080563761152.text:
Just to let y'all know that there's no What's New in Eth2 this week, but last week's edition is still quite fresh ICYMI 

(I'll probably be dropping to every other week-ish so I can get some other stuff done.)

https://notes.ethereum.org/c/Sk8Zs--CQ/ 
http://peepeth.com/p/iEM

https://www.lrz.de/services/compute/museum/sr8000/ziel_en/ …

1107726223214551040.text:
I'm reasonably sure I ran the first computation in Europe at over 1 Teraflop (while benchmarking the SR8000 at LRZ in Munich in 2000).

Now there's about to be a machine one million times faster https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/18/technology/china-us-500-million-supercomputer.html …

I fell into #Ethereum for the technology; I fell in  with #Ethereum for the people. I'm proud to be a signatory to the open letter: https://breakermag.com/open-letter-the-ethereum-community-calls-for-end-to-threats-and-toxic-behavior/ …

Let's keep this the coolest community in the cryptosphere. (Yeah, I know I'm preaching to the choir )

TIL that the Leslie Lamport of LaTeX and the Lamport signature was also among the first to analyse the Byzantine Generals problem. http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.126.9525&rep=rep1&type=pdf …

Super impressive.
